summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, dated November 9, 2021. It transmits additional witness-related materials (Jencks and Giglio) for trial and specifies their designation as confidential under the court's protective order.

events.title: Government Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act and Giglio material regarding potential trial witnesses to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the confidentiality of materials like those being produced.

keyFacts: On November 9, 2021, the U.S. Attorney's Office produced Jencks and Giglio material (witness impeachment and credibility evidence) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
The produced materials are governed by a confidential protective order dated July 31, 2020, and are marked to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The document lists four separate law firms representing Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a substantial defense team.
The letter is signed by Damian Williams in his capacity as United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
The production is related to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330), indicating active pre-trial preparation.
